author: __symmetric
content:
Hey team. 
Just a question about Optimistic vs zk-Rollups for the future of Ethereum. I've done some poking about and can't seem to find the answer to this question:

author: __symmetric
content: Is the idea to lead in with optimism, but later transition everything to a zk-L2 approach? It seems that zk is entirely superior to optimism (apart from implementation complexity).

author: __symmetric
content: And that, while great for fungible tokens, Optimism doesn't appear to have good support for non-fungibles and other more complex state validity for inter-shard communication

author: sky.cactus
content: Optimism is a specific implementation of an Optimistic Rollup.  It also has a semi-trusted mode that I don't personally think should count as optimistic rollups that everyone seems to want (centralized sequencer IIRC).

author: sky.cactus
content: Implementation complexity is a very important aspect.

author: __symmetric
content: Optimism in the sense of the approach, not Optimism the specific implementation

author: ajsutton
content: <@755590043632140352> I’ve deployed another improvement to two different servers which should make a difference. Unfortunately I had to run out the door so not sure what the version string is but if you see a new teku version pop up today that should be it. Seeing a noticeable cpu usage reduction even over the previous fixes.

author: ajsutton
content: There’s more opportunities I can see to improve but this was a big win. Will try to get some more specific metrics in tomorrow.

author: potuz
content: Thanks <@!340345049063882753>, perhaps there aren't that many keys? or you didn't change their graffiti? I don't see anything new, the last 400 blocks produced by teku nodes have only graffities `+17-gc2403bd` and `52-gf055da7` which are the same as the last 400 blocks before epoch 4300.

author: ajsutton
content: Should be about 4000 keys running it.  Graffiti will include 20.12.0+11-gd61487c

author: potuz
content: Oh that's a bit of keys, will relaunch then.

author: ajsutton
content: I'm going to deploy the update to all but the original 2 nodes today - will likely be a slightly different version.

author: ajsutton
content: Give me 20 mins and I'll get it to you.

author: potuz
content: Ah thanks, anyway will need to start collecting data again since otherwise it's an empty experiment
